intro: Galium johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium johnstonii is often found in rich, loamy soils and is a common component of understory vegetation in eastern forests.
